Modern-day society has access to more advanced technology than the Inca civilization did, but this does not necessarily mean that we could achieve the same feats as them. The Inca civilization was unique in its approach to cultural and environmental management, its strong sense of community, and its advanced knowledge in engineering and stonework. Each civilization has its own set of strengths and weaknesses, and it's important to learn from the past but also acknowledge what we can achieve in the world today.

However, we can take inspiration from the Inca civilization's communal culture and sustainable practices. We can learn to prioritize cooperation and sharing of resources to build stronger and more resilient communities. Additionally, their approach to managing their environment sustainably can inspire us to strive for more eco-friendly and sustainable practices in modern-day society.

Overall, while modern technology certainly offers new solutions to problems facing our society, we can still learn valuable lessons from the Inca civilization in areas such as cultural preservation, ecological management, and community building.
